channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The Biden overtime rule was struck down. Now, some workers are losing pay raises
item.description: The overtime rule would have made more than 4 million workers newly eligible to earn overtime on Jan. 1. Then a federal judge in Texas said the Biden administration had gone too far.
item.content:encoded: The overtime rule would have made more than 4 million workers newly eligible to earn overtime on Jan. 1. Then a federal judge in Texas said the Biden administration had gone too far.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: As a kid, I hated playing sports. As an adult, I fell in love with them
item.description: Want to start a new fitness activity? These older athletes have ideas.
item.content:encoded:
Want to start a new fitness activity? These older athletes have ideas.

(Image credit: Juana Summers/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: A desert festival where robots are the headliner
item.description: Scientists are using the Mojave Desert to test robots for the next space age.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists are using the Mojave Desert to test robots for the next space age.

(Image credit: Raymond Alva for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Christopher Intagliata

item.title: Trump claims a 'massive' mandate, but presidents often overread their victories
item.description: There's a long history of presidents claiming that their win means the will of the people is behind their agendas. But elections are rarely full-throated endorsements of a candidate's every policy.
item.content:encoded:
There's a long history of presidents claiming that their win means the will of the people is behind their agendas. But elections are rarely full-throated endorsements of a candidate's every policy.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: How are states spending their opioid settlement cash? Look yours up in this database
item.description: From addiction treatment to toy robot ambulances, here's how state and local governments used billions in opioid settlement funds in 2022 and 2023. Explore this database to find our how officials are using the payouts where you live.
item.content:encoded:
From addiction treatment to toy robot ambulances, here's how state and local governments used billions in opioid settlement funds in 2022 and 2023. Explore this database to find our how officials are using the payouts where you live.

(Image credit: Celia Talbot Tobin for KFF Health News)
item.dc:creator: Aneri Pattani

item.title: The federal EV tax credit has an uncertain fate. What car shoppers should know
item.description: Currently, drivers can get a tax credit worth up to $7,500 for buying or leasing an EV. But the incoming administration promised to roll back those credits, which they consider wasteful spending.
item.content:encoded:
Currently, drivers can get a tax credit worth up to $7,500 for buying or leasing an EV. But the incoming administration promised to roll back those credits, which they consider wasteful spending.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: France rushes help to Mayotte, where hundreds are feared dead from Cyclone Chido
item.description: France was rushing help by ship and military aircraft to its poor overseas territory of Mayotte in the Indian Ocean on Monday after the island was shattered by its worst storm in nearly a century.
item.content:encoded:
France was rushing help by ship and military aircraft to its poor overseas territory of Mayotte in the Indian Ocean on Monday after the island was shattered by its worst storm in nearly a century.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 2 men were arrested in Boston for allegedly flying a drone near the airport
item.description: Two men were arrested in Boston on Saturday for allegedly operating a drone "dangerously close" to Logan International Airport, police said.
item.content:encoded:
Two men were arrested in Boston on Saturday for allegedly operating a drone "dangerously close" to Logan International Airport, police said.

(Image credit: Rodrique Ngowi)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Israel will close its Ireland embassy over Gaza tensions
item.description: Israel said Sunday it will close its embassy in Ireland as relations deteriorated over the war in Gaza, where Palestinian medical officials said new Israeli airstrikes killed over 46 people including several children.
item.content:encoded:
Israel said Sunday it will close its embassy in Ireland as relations deteriorated over the war in Gaza, where Palestinian medical officials said new Israeli airstrikes killed over 46 people including several children.

(Image credit: Tsafrir Abayov)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: As drone sightings spread across East Coast, federal officials still don't know much
item.description: Clusters of drones have been reported flying over at least six states. The Biden administration is pushing Congress to pass legislation that would expand counter-drone authorities.
item.content:encoded:
Clusters of drones have been reported flying over at least six states. The Biden administration is pushing Congress to pass legislation that would expand counter-drone authorities.

(Image credit: Kent Nishimura)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman
